jobs.title: Product Manager / Product Designer (Early Stage Focus)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We're a high-energy, impact-driven team, with a long track record of academic excellence. Our team includes researchers whose work has shaped the field—earning best paper awards at top AI conferences and even ranking among the most cited scientists in history of science. We've built fundamental, transformative research that has redefined the community, and now, we're here to change the world—one breakthrough at a time.

What We're Looking For & Why Join Us

We’re looking for a Product Manager / Product Designer who thrives in early-stage environments and loves shaping something from zero-to-one. You'll be the connective tissue between our users, engineers, and researchers—guiding development toward powerful, usable AI products. This is your opportunity to help define how people interact with the next generation of intelligence.

What is this role?

As a Product Manager / Designer, you’ll lead the discovery, definition, design, and delivery of features that make our AI tools useful, intuitive, and sticky. You’ll collaborate closely with engineering and research to prioritize the right problems, prototype quickly, and ship confidently. You’ll listen deeply to users, synthesize insights, and help drive a product roadmap that balances ambition with execution.

What do we expect?

Must have:

  • 5–12 years experience

  • Worked at early stages of successful product companies (e.g. Figma, Notion, Airbnb, Canva, Instagram, Vercel)

  • Experience prioritizing and shipping features that drive activation, retention, or engagement

  • Strong UX design sensibility with a track record of shaping elegant, intuitive experiences

  • Ability to understand technical constraints and collaborate effectively with engineering and research

  • Comfort working in ambiguity and using first-principles thinking to define goals and product direction

  • Skill in translating user needs and system realities into clear, practical MVPs

  • Strong written and verbal communication, especially when reasoning through product decisions

  • A track record of moving quickly with prototypes, experiments, and iterative learning

Nice to have:

  • AI/ML product experience: features involving models, training data, prompting, or agents

  • Background in CS, data, or machine learning

  • Experience with developer tools, agent-based systems, or infrastructure that supports AI applications

Compensation & Benefits

$100K – $300K + Equity

We offer health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and meaningful equity—because we believe top talent should be supported, secure, and fully invested in the future we’re building together.

Location: Our company is in-office at our Seattle HQ. For this role, we are open to remote candidates with Bay Area experience, regardless of current location.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer – Product / AI Applications
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We're a high-energy, impact-driven team, with a long track record of academic excellence. Our team includes researchers whose work has shaped the field—earning best paper awards at top AI conferences and even ranking among the most cited scientists in history of science. We've built fundamental, transformative research that has redefined the community, and now, we're here to change the world—one breakthrough at a time.

What We're Looking For & Why Join Us

We’re looking for a Backend Engineer – Product / AI Applications who loves working at the intersection of advanced AI and real-world product experiences. Your focus will be on building AI-powered product features that leverage foundation models—from prompt engineering to productionizing agent workflows—so that complex model capabilities translate into intuitive, reliable user-facing experiences. This is your chance to bridge cutting-edge AI with practical applications at scale.

What do we expect?

Must have:

  • Strong experience in prompt engineering best practices across models

  • Familiarity with engineering production AI systems using client/server architectures and relational databases

  • Ability to build reliable, scalable services that connect AI models with user-facing products

  • Comfort balancing rapid experimentation with engineering rigor in production systems

Nice to have:

  • Experience building AI agent applications and ability to adapt quickly to proprietary models.

  • Knowledge of modern AI techniques and their pitfalls (e.g. RAG, prompt caching, context truncation, jailbreaking, CoT, etc).

  • Exposure to observability, evaluation, or safety systems for AI applications

  • Background in full-stack or frontend work to accelerate product development

Compensation & Benefits

$150K – $250K + Equity

We offer health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and meaningful equity—because we believe top talent should be supported, secure, and fully invested in the future we’re building together.

Location: Our company is in-office at our Seattle HQ.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer – Inference Optimization
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We're a high-energy, impact-driven team, with a long track record of academic excellence. Our team includes researchers whose work has shaped the field—earning best paper awards at top AI conferences and even ranking among the most cited scientists in history of science. We've built fundamental, transformative research that has redefined the community, and now, we're here to change the world—one breakthrough at a time.

What We're Looking For & Why Join Us

We’re looking for a Backend Engineer – Inference Optimization who thrives on solving some of the hardest systems problems in AI. You’ll focus on pushing the limits of foundation model inference performance, working at the intersection of cutting-edge ML and high-performance systems engineering. This is your opportunity to set new benchmarks for latency, throughput, and efficiency at scale.

What is this role?

As a Backend Engineer, you’ll own the design and optimization of inference pipelines for large-scale models. You’ll work closely with researchers and infrastructure engineers to identify bottlenecks, implement advanced techniques like quantization and KV caching, and deploy high-performance serving systems in production. Your work will directly determine how fast and cost-effectively users can access next-generation AI.

What do we expect?

Must have:

  • Deep experience in optimizing model inference pipelines, model quantization and KV caching.

  • Proficiency in backend systems and high-performance programming (Python, C++, or Rust)

  • Familiarity with distributed serving, GPU acceleration, and large-scale systems

  • Ability to debug complex performance issues across model, runtime, and hardware layers

  • Comfort working in fast-moving environments with ambitious technical goals

Nice to have:

  • Hands-on experience with vLLM or similar inference frameworks

  • Background in GPU kernel optimization (CUDA, Triton, ROCm)

  • Experience scaling inference across multi-node or heterogeneous clusters

  • Prior work in model compilation (e.g., TensorRT, TVM, ONNX Runtime)

  • Hands-on experience with model quantization

Compensation & Benefits

$150K – $250K + Equity

We offer health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and meaningful equity—because we believe top talent should be supported, secure, and fully invested in the future we’re building together.

Location: Our company is in-office at our Seattle HQ.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Engineer – Core Product
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us
We’re a high-energy, impact-driven team with a long track record of academic and technical excellence. Our founders and researchers have shaped the field of AI—earning best paper awards at top conferences and ranking among the most cited scientists in history. After building transformative research that redefined what’s possible, we’re now focused on bringing that power to everyday users.

What We’re Looking For & Why Join Us
We’re looking for a Full-Stack Engineer excited to build intuitive, high-performance products powered by advanced AI. You’ll design and ship experiences that make complex workflows feel effortless—whether for our own research team or for external users discovering Vy for the first time.

If you care about clean architecture, seamless UX, and shipping real impact fast, this is your chance to shape the next generation of AI-powered software. At Vercept, every team member plays a core role in pushing technology to its next 100x leap.

What is this role?
As a Full-Stack Engineer, you’ll collaborate with designers, backend engineers, and researchers to turn cutting-edge AI systems into production-ready tools and user experiences. You’ll build across the stack—from frontend interfaces in React to backend APIs in Next.js and Python—and help define how our systems scale as we grow.

What do we expect?

Must have:
 • Strong experience with React, TypeScript, and modern web frameworks
• Comfort working across the stack (we use Next.js and write a lot of Python)
• Experience integrating APIs and managing state in complex applications
• A focus on creating smooth, responsive, and accessible user experiences
• Strong product sense—balancing speed, usability, and technical quality

Nice to have:
 • Experience with AI or data-driven products
• Familiarity with design systems or UX design tools
• Interest in emerging UX patterns for AI-driven interfaces
• Exposure to backend performance optimization or distributed systems

Compensation & Benefits
 $100K – $250K + Equity

We offer health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and meaningful equity—because we believe top talent should be supported, secure, and fully invested in the future we’re building together.

Location: Our company is in-office at our Seattle HQ.

jobs.title: Frontend + UX Designer (50/50 Hybrid)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We're a high-energy, impact-driven team, with a long track record of academic excellence. Our team includes researchers whose work has shaped the field—earning best paper awards at top AI conferences and even ranking among the most cited scientists in history of science. We've built fundamental, transformative research that has redefined the community, and now, we're here to change the world—one breakthrough at a time.

What We're Looking For & Why Join Us

We’re looking for a Frontend + UX Designer (50/50 Hybrid) who thrives at the intersection of design and engineering. You’ll own both the user experience and the frontend implementation of our AI-powered products. This is your chance to shape how millions of users interact with next-generation AI—by combining design sensibility with engineering rigor.

What is this role?

As our Frontend + UX Designer, you’ll help shape the end-to-end experience of our AI systems, ensuring they are intuitive, engaging, and impactful. You’ll work closely with engineers, researchers, and users to translate complex AI capabilities into seamless, user-friendly interactions, while also owning the frontend implementation of the interfaces you design—building performant, responsive, and polished products.

What do we expect?

Must have:

  • Proficiency in TypeScript and Node.js

  • Strong UX and visual design skills, with proficiency in Figma, prototyping tools, and design systems

  • Experience implementing designs in modern frontend frameworks (React preferred)

  • Creativity in exploring novel interaction patterns, especially for emerging AI UX

  • Ability to conduct and synthesize user research to guide product decisions

  • Comfort working in ambiguity and evolving priorities, with a bias toward iteration and clarity

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills in cross-functional teams

Compensation & Benefits

$100K – $200K + Equity

We offer health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and meaningful equity—because we believe top talent should be supported, secure, and fully invested in the future we're building together.

Location: Our company is in-office at our Seattle HQ.

jobs.title: Member of Technical Staff
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

We're a high-energy, impact-driven team, with a long track record of academic excellence. Our team includes researchers whose work has shaped the field—earning best paper awards at top AI conferences and even ranking among the most cited scientists in history of science. We've built fundamental, transformative research that has redefined the community, and now, we're here to change the world—one breakthrough at a time.

What We're Looking For & Why Join Us

We seek a self-driven engineer or researcher passionate about advancing and applying cutting-edge AI products. You'll help bring our advanced AI systems to millions of users worldwide. This is your chance to be at the forefront of AI's next big leap. At Vercept, every team member is core to shaping our future and pushing technology to its next 100x impact.

What is this role?

As a Member of Technical Staff at Vercept, you'll have the flexibility to shape your role based on your interests and strengths. Whether you want to specialize deeply in one area or work across multiple domains, you'll:

• This is a very flexible role, and you'll be able to shape your role based on your interests and strengths

• Contribute to projects spanning research, ML infrastructure and engineering, data systems, or production deployment

• Choose to specialize in areas like model research and development, distributed systems, or full-stack development

• Work at the intersection of research and engineering to bring AI systems to life

What do we expect?

• Strong fundamentals in either software engineering or applied research—we value depth over specific tech stacks

• Ability to pick up new technologies quickly and adapt as our needs evolve

• Experience in any of: distributed systems, ML infrastructure, model training, full-stack development, or data engineering

• Track record of taking ownership and driving technical projects or research initiatives to completion

• Strong Interest in AI/ML systems

Compensation & Benefits

$100K – $300K + Equity

We offer health benefits, a 401(k) plan, and meaningful equity—because we believe top talent should be supported, secure, and fully invested in the future we're building together.

Location: Our company is in-office at our Seattle HQ.
